info.description: Use MotaWord API to post and track your translation projects.
info.title: MotaWord API

parameters.name: locale

parameters.description: When `true`, and no article is found in the locale, it falls back to `locale=en`.

get.summary: Get blog posts - ordered by created desc by default

get.description: Find documents similar to this document. Optionally, include translation information.

post.description: Use the translation of the given manual document as a regular file.

get.summary: Returns your vendor earnings. Includes real-time earnings from ongoing projects, and fixed earnings from completed projects. Also includes total earnings and string edits.

parameters.description: Profile picture file contents. Accepted extensions are png, jpg.
parameters.name: profile_picture

parameters.description: Filter projects by status. Accepts multiple statuses. Possible values 'pending', 'started', 'completed'

items.description: progress-related project status enums are not supported, such as "translated", "proofread".

parameters.name: status[]

get.description: Get a list of your projects
get.summary: Get a list of your projects

parameters.description: Optional. If you provide a callback URL, we will send POST callbacks when the status of the current project is changed. Possible status changes are, 'translated', 'proofread', 'completed'.
parameters.name: callback_url

parameters.description: Optional. This is a consistent custom data parameter that will be given to you in the response across every request of this project model. Values should be provided like this, custom[my_key] = my_value.
parameters.name: custom

parameters.description: Optional. You can add as many files as you want in documents[] parameter. Or you add your documents later in separate calls.
parameters.name: documents[]

parameters.description: Optional. Only one glossary is supported at the moment.
parameters.name: glossaries[]

parameters.description: Optional. You can add as many files as you want in styleguides[] parameter. Or you add your style guides later in separate calls.
parameters.name: styleguides[]

post.summary: Get a new quote

parameters.description: Return only projects that this user has already joined
parameters.name: joined

parameters.description: Return only projects that have been completed. When `true`, this makes `joined` true as well.
parameters.name: completed

400.description: VendorNotFound - this is not a vendor user account

get.description: Get a list of your vendor projects

get.description: Get single project
get.summary: Get single project

parameters.description: Optional. If you provide a callback URL, we will send POST callbacks when the status of the current project is changed. Possible status changes are, 'translated', 'proofread', 'completed'.
parameters.name: callback_url

parameters.description: Optional. This is a consistent custom data parameter that will be given to you in the response across every request of this project model. Values should be provided like this, custom[my_key] = my_value. If you previously provided one, it will be replaced.
parameters.name: custom

get.description: Trigger a call to your callback URL related to this project.
get.summary: Trigger a call to your callback URL related to this project.

post.summary: Cancel your translation project
Deliver project

200.description: Translation package streamed. The streamed file is always a ZIP file, except when the API client is configured for Drupal and Wordpress.

get.description: Download the latest translation package. You must have given a /package call beforehand and wait until the packaging status is 'completed'.
get.summary: Download the latest translation package.

parameters.description: Language code. You can download the translation of only a specific language.
parameters.name: language

200.description: Translation package streamed. The streamed file is always a ZIP file, except when the API client is configured for Drupal and Wordpress.

get.description: Download only the translation package of this language. You must have given a /package call beforehand and wait until the packaging status is 'completed'.
get.summary: Download the latest translation package.

get.description: Get invoice details
get.summary: Get invoice details

get.description: Download invoice as html by project id.
get.summary: Download invoice as hmtl

get.description: Download invoice as pdf by project id.
get.summary: Download invoice as pdf

parameters.description: Last 4 digits of the credit card you are using one-time. This parameter is only required when stripe_token is provided.
parameters.name: bin

parameters.description: Optional with corporate accounts. Not available for others.
parameters.name: budget_code

parameters.description: Optional. `client`, `app`, `corporate_card` methods require a credit card ID. `credit` method requires Stripe token and bin.
parameters.name: card_id

parameters.description: Optional. Determines which method to use for payment. `client`, `app`, `corporate_card` methods require a credit card ID. `credit` method requires Stripe token and bin. `corporate` method follows corporate account policy automatically, either follows invoicing flow or automatically charges corporate's primary card.
parameters.name: payment_method

parameters.description: This is required if you are using a one-time credit card. This is the token generted from frontend via Stripe SDK. If you are using a one-time card with `stripe_token`, you must also provide `bin`, last 4 digits of the card.
parameters.name: stripe_token

post.summary: Launch your translation project

parameters.description: If you want to package and download the translation synchronously, mark this parameter as '0'. It will package the translation and then return the packaged file in the response, identical to /download call after an asynchronous /package call.
parameters.name: async

post.description: Package the translation project, make it ready to be downloaded.
post.summary: Package the translation of all languages to be downloaded.

parameters.description: This is the package tracking key provided in the response of a /package call.
parameters.name: key

get.description: This request will tell you the current progress of the translation packaging. You will use the 'key' provided by the /package call.
get.summary: Track the status of translation packaging.

parameters.description: Language code. You can package the translation of only a specific language.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: If you want to package and download the translation synchronously, mark this parameter as '0'. It will package the translation and then return the packaged file in the response, identical to /download call after an asynchronous /package call.
parameters.name: async

200.description: Packaging status and tracking code. With the package key, you can track the progress of translation packaging.Also packaged translation streamed.

post.description: Package the translation project, make it ready to be downloaded.
post.summary: Package the translation of a specific target language to be downloaded.

parameters.description: This will return a more raw progress information for translation and proofreading. For instance, when completed, we will return 100% for both tasks by default, whereas their actual progress may be lower than 100%.
parameters.name: raw

get.description: Get the progress of an already launched project.
get.summary: Get project progress

post.summary: Recreate your translation project from scratch. This is a risky action, you will lose current translations.
Submit reports for a project

delete.description: Delete project webhooks. Projects currently support registering only 1 webhook. This endpoint deletes the previously registered webhook.

get.description: Get project information (includes callback_url for webhook). Currently projects can have only 1 webhook registered.
get.summary: Get project information (includes callback_url for webhook)

callback_url.description: Webhook URL. We will send POST callbacks when the status of the current project is changed. Possible status changes are, 'translated', 'proofread', 'completed'.

post.summary: Update project webhook URL

callback_url.description: Webhook URL. We will send POST callbacks when the status of the current project is changed. Possible status changes are, 'translated', 'proofread', 'completed'.

target_text.description: Target text of the activity, which is actually the translation of the source text.

translator.description: Unique identifier of the translator/proofreader of this activity.

type.description: Currently there are two available activity types; 'translated', 'proofread'.

name.description: addressing name, such as company name. used in billing address.

created_at.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

url.description: The URL that received the callback.

last_changed.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z
the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

activity.description: Link to the activity to which this comment was submitted.

date.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

additionalProperties.description: MotaWord admin link for this file, in this language code.
MotaWord editor link for this file, in this language code.

preview-box.description: Box.com URL to preview this document. This URL is temporary. You need to re-fetch the file to refresh the Box.com preview URL. Available for documents and style guides.

preview-pdf.description: This is our fallback preview URL, providing a PDF file. Use this file to embed in your PDF viewer. Available for documents and style guides.

preview-pdf-viewer.description: This is another version of preview-pdf, this time pointing to a preview viewer page on front application. This page requires authentication and comes with its own PDF viewer.

thumbnail.description: Thumbnail preview URL of the document. If doc has a page structure, this is probably only the first page.

due_date.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

invoiced_at.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

source.description: Preferred source names are listed as enum. If you have a custom file type, simply enter that name.

key.description: This is the unique package tracking key. You can use this key to track the current progress of the translation packaging with /package/check call.

PackageStatusEnum.description: The status of translation packaging. Possible values are 'started', 'packaging', 'completed'. When completed, you can make a /download call to download the last translation package.

callback_url.description: Callback URL to notify when project status changed.

client.description: User entity for Client. This is only given when project is requested with detailed=true

completed_on.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

custom.description: Custom data provided while creating a new project.

errors.description: A list of errors. Visible when creating a project and uploading your documents at the same time, in case of multiple errors.

pairs.description: Currently authed vendor's available working language pairs in this project. Includes rates per language pair. Includes complex pair logic such as bilingualism, project reverse pair enforcement etc.

usd_amount.description: USD is our base pricing currency. If `currency` is different, this will help.
USD is our base pricing currency. If `currency` is different, this will help.

source.descriptipon: The source platform where this project was first created. Current options are "api", "web".

tms_name.description: TMS project name for this MW project. Requires privileged scope.

valid_until.description: Unix epoch time. Available only if status is `pending`.

is_above_average.description: Is this score above or below the average among other vendors in the same project?

strings_edited.description: The number of translated strings by this translator which was edited by a proofreader.

strings_translated.description: The number of translated strings by this translator.

budget_code.description: budget code filter. valid for corporate accounts only.

date_from.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

date_to.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

users.description: List of corporate user IDs. Valid for corporate accounts only.

last_updated.description: the date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

type.description: String search result typ from ZNT. Options are LOCAL_PROJECT, IMPORTED_TM. Imported TM results should probably not be visible to end users.

nps.description: \@deprecated. use /stats endpoint for the current nps value.

zip_code.description: \@deprecated. use mailing or billing key. new key name is "zip".

require_1099.description: Optional. Whether this vendor requires 1099 form in US for their earnings.

total.description: total amount of USD that this user has earned in the platform so far.

is_proofreader.description: Indicates if the vendor be able to proofred this pair

VendorProjectRole.description: Currently authed vendor's role in this project. If vendor has already joined, this contains the role they joined the project with. If not joined yet, this is the role that they can join the project with.

invited.description: total number of projects that this user was invited to. TODO this key is to replace "total" key due to naming ambiguity.

total.description: total number of projects that this user was invited to.

worked.description: total number of projects that this user actually worked on.

approved.description: total number of words that this user has approved so far.

translated.description: total number of words that this user has translated so far.
